channel.title: stock analysis on CodingEconomist
channel.description: Recent content in stock analysis on CodingEconomist

item.title: Overview of revenues and profits of the Pharmaceutical and Biotech industries with Python and SQL - part 1
item.description: How does the Pharmaceutical industry compare to the Biotech industry in terms of yearly revenue and profit?? Introduction How to define the Pharmaceutical and Biotech industries? According to Investopedia Biotechnology and Pharmaceutical companies both produce medicines. However, the medicines made by Biotechnology companies are derived from living organisms while those made by Pharmaceutical companies generally have a chemical basis. In particular, Biotechnology harnesses cellular and biomolecular processes to develop technologies and products.

item.title: Reading Nvidia SEC filings with SQL and Sentence Transformers - Part III
item.description: How to analyze Nvidia SEC filings - Part III Introduction This series of articles is made of three parts. In part I of this series we explored frequency word count for the most common words in Nvidia SEC filings. In part II we explored the most important sentences from the company’s SEC filings and we were overwhelmed by the number of them. In the final part III of this series, will try to reduce the number of sentences to a more manageable position by eliminating repeating sentences from previous years in order to streamline the analysis.

item.title: Reading Nvidia SEC filings with the help of Natural Language Processing - Part II
item.description: How to analyze Nvidia SEC filings - Part II Introduction This series of articles is made of three parts. In part I of this series we explored frequency word count for the most common words in Nvidia SEC filings. In this part, which is part II, we are going a step further, and try to explore the most important sentences from the company’s SEC filings. The last part III of the series will explore comparison of SEC filing statements across different time periods and elimination of repeating sentences in order to narrow down the research.

item.title: Reading Nvidia financial reports with the help of Natural Language Processing - Part I
item.description: How to analyze Nvidia financial report - Part I Introduction Reading financial reports of any company usually takes a lot of time. Even more time is required to compare financial reports across different years. According to some analysts, it may take months or even years of digging into company reports in order to get well acquainted with the company, and get a good understanding of its operations. This is part one of a broader series of articles which will present the use of Natural Language Processing techniques for company financial reports analysis.

item.title: The problem with Intel's SEC filings and NLP
item.description: The Problem with Intel’s SEC filings and Natural Language Processing Objective The aim of this article was to show how chipmaker Intel Corporation makes use of their own 10-K form which differs substantially from the SEC 10-K, making automation of document reading much more difficult for analysts. Methodology The main method used in this article is visual presentation and discussion. Results In its latest 10-K SEC filing, Intel Corporation states as follows:

item.title: Using NLP and SEC filings to explore hitech companies
item.description: Analysis of hitech companies Introduction Recently a survey was conducted among participants of investing channel on reddit. The original poster asked redditors to name technologies and companies worth investing in, for future growth and profits. Responses among reddit users are usually open ended and vague, however several technologies were named, such as: biotechnology and genome sequencing, microchip production, micro nuclear reactors, solid state batteries, quantum computing and others. Also, several publicly traded companies were named and their trading ticker was provided.

item.title: Interest Rates and Stock Market - do rising interest rates harm the stock market?
item.description: Are rising interest rates bad for the stock market? Introduction On January 10th, Federal Reserve Chairman Powell spoke at the hearing, saying that the economy after the epidemic may be different from the previous expansion, the US labor market is strong, and policies must be considered forward-looking, and tools will be used to support the economy and employment. market. In fact, since the Fed released the early signal of raising interest rates last week, the market’s expectations for interest rate hikes in March have begun to rise sharply.
